Class TestUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.testing.TestUtils

public class TestUtils
extends java.lang.Object

TestUtils, a simple package for utility functions helpful when writing unit tests

Method Detail

findTestData

public static java.net.URL findTestData(java.lang.String path)
                                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
method to find a file relative to the calling class. primarily useful when writing tests that need access to external data. this lets you put the data relative to the test class file.

Parameters:
path - the path, relative to caller's location
Returns:
URL a URL referencing the file
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the calling class can not be found (i.e., should not happen)

Parameters:

array - to write out

Parameters:
query - The query to find the persistent object should be formulated to ensure a single object is returned or an error will occur.
Returns:
Object found or null if not
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there was a Hibernate related exception

lookupFromCacheById

public static java.lang.Object lookupFromCacheById(java.lang.Long id,
                                                   java.lang.String queryname)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Helper method to get a single object from the 2nd level cache by id

Parameters:
id - Id of the object you want
queryname - Queryname for the query you want to run. queryname *MUST* have an :id attribute in it.
Returns:
Returns the object corresponding to id
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - exception

                                                      java.lang.String queryname)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
label - Label of the object you want
queryname - Queryname for the query you want to run. queryname *MUST* have a :label attribute in it.
Returns:
Returns the object corresponding to label
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - exception

printWhoCalledMe

public static void printWhoCalledMe(int depth)
Print the first few lines from a stacktrace so we can figure out who the caller is. This is similiar to doing a Thread.dumpStack() but it just doesn't spit out as many lines of the stacktrace.

Parameters:
depth - the number of lines of the stacktrace you want to see

enableLocalizationDebugMode

public static void enableLocalizationDebugMode()
Sets the Config to indicate we want to be in Debug mode for Localization. Usefull for checking if a set of strings is l10ned.

disableLocalizationDebugMode

public static void disableLocalizationDebugMode()
Turns of the Config setting for L10N debug mode

disableLocalizationLogging

public static void disableLocalizationLogging()
Disable the *** ERROR: Message with id: [asciiString] not found.*** errors. Some tests pass in non-translated strings which is OK.

enableLocalizationLogging

public static void enableLocalizationLogging()
Enable the *** ERROR: Message with id: [asciiString] not found.*** errors. Some tests pass in non-translated strings which is OK.

isLocalized

Check the string to see if it passed through the LocalizationService.

Parameters:
checkMe - String to check if it was l10ned
Returns:
boolean if or not it was localized

validateUIMessage

public static boolean validateUIMessage(ActionHelper ah,
                                        java.lang.String key)
Check the request in the ActionHelper to validate that there is a UI message in the session. Useful for struts actions where you want to verify that it put something in the session.

Parameters:
ah - actionhelper used in the test
key - to the i18n resource
Returns:
boolean if it was found or not

randomString

public static java.lang.String randomString()
Return a random 13 letter string. Useful for creating unique string labels/names in your tests.

Returns:
String that is 13 chars long and alphanumeric

arraySearch

                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  java.lang.Object key)
Search an array by calling the passsed in method name with the key as the checker

Parameters:
search - array
methodName - to call on each object in the array (can be toString())
key - to compare to
Returns:
boolean if found or not

getPrivateField

public static java.lang.Object getPrivateField(java.lang.Object o,
                                               java.lang.String fieldName)
Get a private field from a class. Good for testing the inner state of a class's member variables. Copied from: http://snippets.dzone.com/posts/show/2242

Parameters:
o - to check
fieldName - to find
Returns:
Object if found
